reviews.text: Well...My friend and I spent HOURS trying to find a cheap hotel online but all we could seem to find was hostels. Every single hostel had bad reviews. So we were ademate that we were going to find a cheap hotel with a good review on here(trip advisor)...NOT an easy task!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: Somehow, after about a week of searching the net for 2 hours a night(SERIOUSLY!) we came across a deal which was very reasonable...10 days at the Americana Inn including flight.
reviews.title: A Diamond in the ROUGH

reviews.text: So...we checked in on April 18th. My friend and I booked like within 10 minutes of eachother but somehow he got the short straw, I had a sink..he didn't. I had a mirror...he didn't. So I guess theres no telling if you room will have those or not...but in all fair it doens't matter.
reviews.title: Great for young singles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing that worried us about the hotel was sharing bathrooms. luckily it was a waist of time worrying about it cause we soon realised the bathrooms were immaculate, VERY clean! Theres about 3 on every floor to so your never waiting to use the bathroom which was really my main concern.
reviews.title: We loved the Americana Inn Hotel in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly, very helpful...i HIGHLY recommend this place to the budget-minded traveller.
reviews.title: not the waldorf, but reasonable for the location

likes.disliked: — noisy A/C unit, no sink as shown on website.

reviews.text: Got a last-minute room at the Americana for a recent trip to New York. I was concerned about the shared bathrooms due to negative experiences I had with shared facilities in London, but Americana is extremely clean and there was never a wait. The rooms don't have refrigerators, but are also clean, with flat-screen tv's and a sink. Also, the locations is excellent for tourists -- right in Midtown, near the subway, the Empire State Building and Times Square.
reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is AWESOME! It is so close to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, FIFTH AVENUE for shopping, and really close to the subway to get down Manhattan to Statue of Liberty etc. My room had a window and I definitely recommend buying ear plugs as the traffic is very loud and all night. But the rooms are a good size and clean and the price is very reasonable.
reviews.title: Awesome location, though get earplugs
Americana Inn is "barebones " in a great location
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location and central to the library, short walk to Herald Square, and Time Square. We were able to access shops, restaurants, a great park without having to walk far. The staff was friendly and tried their best to assist you with any questions. However, I did request extra pillows for my stay and had to request several times before I was able to get them. The first night,we were on the second floor, not a good location, too much traffic and noise. Rooms are small and "barebones" in terms of accomodations. Some rooms lack sinks and lamps for reading. I would rate the hotel as one step above a youth hostel. It is okay for a short stay 3 or less nights. We stayed a total of 8 nights. Next time we visit NYC we would probably stay at another hotel with better amenties ,however, this place is okay for a short stay if you are on a tight budget.
This hotel is an ideal location when staying in New York. One block from 5th Ave, one block from Times Square, 5-10 mins walk to Central Park, Empire State Building and 30 seconds from Macy's!
reviews.title: Ideal Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly, hotel was clean and the a/c system was excellent considering the extreme heat in NYC!
reviews.title: A Pleasant Experience

likes.disliked: — sharing bathrooms, no problem, but i wish i had my own!

reviews.title: TOP SPOT
reviews.text: Great location! Room was comfortable but small, but we were hardly in it except to sleep! Share bathroom was always clean and never had to wait! Would stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was for only 1 night but were very pleased with our experience. The room was small but very clean, it had a sink and a small flat panel TV. We thought the shared bathrooms was going to be a problem, however they were very clean and the room is yours once your in there. Plus there was about 1 bathroom for every 3 rooms, we didn't have any problems with waiting on other guests. In fact the only time we ran into other guests was in the lobby. The staff was very friendly, the night we stayed it was raining and the man at the front desk loaned us an umbrella.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 2 weeks at the Americana Inn in April/May 2006.We actually chose it because of its central location: near the main attractions, 5th avenue, Empire State Building and Time Square.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money!!!

likes.liked: — The price, the location, the comfort of the room and the cleanliness

reviews.text: We had a great stay there: even though the room was very small, it was very clean, and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great location, great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a double room with a sink, a wardrobe, a chest and a large window. Obviously it's NYC and it's sometimes a bit noisy but it's ok.
reviews.title: not too bad but spend a few bucks more

reviews.text: The Americana Inn is close walking distance to the subway and is in a safe neighborhood with cafes and the amazing Little Korea (with delicious Korean BBQ restaurants) nearby. The room and shared baths were very clean, but the twin/twin room was MUCH smaller than the picture shown on the website - the 2 twins were literally about a foot apart with no nightstands. The front desk was friendly and helpful and the hotel felt to be kept secure. One major drawback was the road noise from our room which faced the intersection of 6th and 38th - I expect noise in the city but the windows were not able to be tightly shut and as a result it was almost as load inside as outside - bring earplugs! And overall good experience.
reviews.title: Clean, central, friendly but with tiny rooms and very loud traffic noise

reviews.text: Hot, smelly, dirty and not even that cheap. Avoid like the plague
reviews.title: Terrible hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for six nights and let's be honest, if you're expecting luxury this is not where you would find it. BUT the hotel is clean and basic and has most everything you need for a budget stay in the city that never sleeps. The bedroom on the top floor had twin beds, a shared bedside table, a small closet with about 6 hangers in and a sink with a light on. My biggest gripe was NO mirror in the room which was a bit annoying with two girls getting ready every morning. Saying that though, the shared bathrooms were normally very clean (obviously when they had just been used they got a little mucky- but the maids were excellent and kept them clean every day!) It would have been nice to have paper towels to dry hands or soap to wash hands because you hardly remember to take a towel every time you go to the toilet. The shower wasn't very powerful and did stop randomly a couple of times - but did turn back on after a couple of minutes and was hot and fine. Also there were no worry about getting into the bathrooms because you could always nip to another floor you were stuck.
reviews.title: Clean but basic, a place to chill for a while..

reviews.text: Overall it was clean and basic. Little touches like paper hand towels in bathroom, and a mirror in the bedroom would have made it even better, but for the price you can't really complain. Asked for a hairdryer at reception every morning and got one and used a safety deposit box behind reception too which was fine. Lift was kinda HOT and a bit slow, and slightly annoying because it dinged a lot. Air con handy when we stayed because wass very warm but could not really leave it on all night because was very noisy. NYC is the kinda place which you expect beeping horns and trash being broken up in the night so just expect it and take it in as the city experience. Location very good for hotel- minutes walk from good midtown attractions- do the Rockefeller Centre at night very pretty and enjoyed Madame Tussauds in Times Square. Enjoy
reviews.title: Absolute Horror

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start, this is not a hotel or a motel - it's a hostel. The room was reminiscent of a city morgue and it smelled as such. Shared bathrooms are an absolute disaster, I elected not to shower. I should also mention that I slept in my clothes for fear of catching something from the mattress. I tried contacting my booking agent, but I couldn't dial a 1-800 number from my room, I had to use a payphone which was located in the lobby. Disaster.
reviews.title: worst hotel i've ever stayed in

reviews.text: When I stayed at this hotel I was a student and didn't have means to stay in a more expensive hotel hence this one was ideal.
reviews.title: Great value and location

likes.disliked: — Room size was a little small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel to be very good value. Its location was good, with a short walk to Times Square, 5th Avenue shops, Macy's, near the subway etc. The hotel did not provide breakfast, but there are good deli's and coffee shops near by.
reviews.title: All or nothing in NY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms had shared bathrooms, but I had no problems getting hot water whatever time of day and the bathrooms and bedrooms were clean and in good condition
reviews.title: Great GREAT GREAT LOCATION
What are you thinking?
reviews.text: For when I was in the hotel room, it was a single room, which was a little small. But the air con worked and the TV had plenty of stations.

reviews.title: Great Place on a Buget.
reviews.text: No issues with excess noise and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After an exhaustive search and a cancellation at The Jane, I chose the Americana Inn for it's price and double bed, rather than bunk beds. I got the room a couple dollars cheaper on Priceline. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The place is immaculately clean and the aesthetic is nice. Excellent coffee shop across the street, walking distance to everything, subway close. The shared bathrooms were not a problem, they were dirty once or twice, but not for long, they clean quite frequently.
reviews.title: Clean but Horribly Hot and Stuffy

reviews.text: Now, the problem. And why I will NEVER stay here again. It was so freaking HOT and stuffy we could not sleep without the window open (earplugs needed) and the door to our room OPEN so there was cross ventilation. Yes, that's right, we slept with the door open to our room. There was no choice. There is absolutely NO ventilation system in the entire hotel.
reviews.title: Extremely happy

reviews.text: To their credit, I did ask the front desk about this and he pointed to a air conditioner mounted on a board behind him. He said that they were in the process of outfitting all the rooms with AC. Please double check this before booking. Do NOT stay here in the summer without AC, you will be sorry.
reviews.title: Cheap & Perfect Location

reviews.text: I chose this hotel by opening the yellow pages & finding the cheapest-sounding hotel (I didnt have internet at the time of booking). Paying $80 a night, I wasnt expecting much but I was really happy. Although the room was small, and the lack of carpet made me feel like I was in jail, it was pretty clean, and the hotel was quiet. I had a TV, sink & closet in the room, and the bathroom was roomy, with a shower and toilet.
reviews.title: Good base for your holiday
New York Night
reviews.text: The bathroom was a little unclean however, but I think I used it just before the cleaning ladies came, because the next time I went in it was spotless. The front desk staff were very nice, and there was a soda machine and an internet-connected computer for free use in the lobby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is really good value. It's fairly basic, with shared bathrooms but this is common in NY anyway. There was a sink in our room and towels, shampoo and shower gel provided. It was very clean and the staff were good. We didn't use the kitchen but i think they were pretty basic - it's as cheap to eat out as do a supermarket shop here anyway! For a central location and good price, so long as you're not wanting anything too big or fancy, this is worth a look - we'd definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Lovely budget hotel - recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Americana as a last resort due to planning our trip at short notice. This Hotel is in Mid-town which is a decent neighbourhood in manhattan making it easy to access the other parts of the city. The hotel is about 3-5 blocks from the subway depending on which subway station you choose.
reviews.title: Just Bad.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, another note worthy thing that is not mentioned anywhere is that people live in this hotel. We had no creepy or weird experiences with the residents of this building but having residents in the same building as a hotel is something worth mentioning so people booking it are at least aware.
reviews.title: disgusting ring worm
Excellent budget option
reviews.text: The rooms are waaaaay smaller than the Pod Hotel which is a comparative price in the same neighborhood. The room is just barely big enough to fit the double bed in the room, a tiny dresser that you couldn't use if you wanted to due to it's proximity to the bed (to close to open the drawers). There is also a closet and small sink in the room. However, there is no mirror in the room making it difficult to apply makeup, or do your hair without going into the somewhat dirty shared bathrooms. The room could not have been bigger than 75 or 80 square feet. It was very difficult for two people to sleep and get ready in this room for two days.
The bathrooms were not the worst shared bathrooms i have ever seen but they were not clean. There was other peoples hair all over them. There was also nothing to dry your hands on after washing them.
reviews.title: Great little place in the centre of Manhattan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Americana Inn for four nights in February. Just some helpful tips: The hotel is on the corner of 6th ave and 38th street, on 6th you will see a blue sign above a cafe on the corner with the hotel name, then turn the corner to 38th st and the hotel is just a couple doors down, with a green door, press the buzzer to enter. The lobby is one floor up, there is an elevator and stairs, I think there are about 5-6 floors. The lobby has a vending machine for drinks and a stand for pamphlets that have coupons for attractions in the city. We stayed on the 2nd floor, which if I were to do it again, I would ask for a room on a higher level and for a room with a view. The main floor just has too much commotion with cleaning staff and the elevator dinging at all hours. But there are about 15-20 rooms and 4 bathrooms per floor which was never a problem for us, I would suggest using your do not disturb sign when going into the washroom because people tend to try to open the door before knocking. The room itself was small for two people but it was enough for the price. There is a little closet with hangers, a desk, chair, sink, and mirror. The cleaning staff bring fresh towels every day and tidy the room. I would recommend bringing a wash cloth or loofah to help scrub off the layers of sweat from walking in the city. There is free cable in your room which is awesome. The walls are super thin so you can hear everyone walking around and the cleaning staff are really loud in the morning, try a higher floor and maybe it wouldn't be a problem. Overall the hotel was pretty nice, if you're looking for a place to keep your stuff and crash for the night, this hotel works. It is right near bryant park and times square, its within walking distance to central park, its a great location especially for the price. If you're on a budget but want to have fun exploring the city, I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location for a Budget Hotel

reviews.text: Tis hotel is well located, in the heart of new york, everything is close by,,,the rooms are average what you could expect for a budget hotel, but clean! service from the staff was very helpful, i stayed during the NYE so it was pretty busy but the staff always found time to help out, overall is well located is cheap but clean and the staff is helpfull. (bathrooms are not inside the rooms but we never had to wait, there is like 5 batrooms per floor)
reviews.title: Good bang for your buck!!

reviews.text: This is a great place to stay without going completely broke in NYC---stayed here recently for the third time and absolutely love this "little tiny hotel" It is worth the money, rooms are clean, bathrooms are in the hall but very clean (5 bathrooms to every floor in a 5-story building), never had to wait in line for bathroom. Was noisy from outside streets---but hey, NYC is the city that never sleeps anyway. Could ask for an inside room that is somewhat helpful. Soap/shampoo/towels included everyday by cleaning staff. Like the convenient kitchenetts with fridge and microwave. Staff is very friendly and helpful; got my needed wakeup call at 4:00 am; and luggage held in office after checkout. Was appreciative of honest staff: friend lost white bathrobe---by accidental pickup upon room cleanup---reported to staff and was located by housekeeping and returned! Hotel highly recommended, look at this hotel as my "timeshare" away from home.
reviews.title: Good for budget minded travelers

reviews.text: The room was VERY small and because the hotel is located near the street it's very loud. I double checked several times whether my window is really closed because it was so noisy!
reviews.title: Cheap-Loud-Simple-> Spend better more money and have a great hotel room!

reviews.text: Also, the room was cold and I had no bathroom.
reviews.title: mildew and pubic hair but close to times square
